comment.author: 77788549@N05
comment._content: Robert Brown of 118 Blythe Street, off Sandy Row, Belfast, born in 1895.  He volunteered as Service Number 17 / 1313 Rifleman Robert Brown in D Company, 8th Battalion Royal Irish Rifles.

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content: 8th Battalion Royal Irish Rifles (East Belfast) went over the top on 1st July 1916, the first day of the Battle of the Somme, in 107th Brigade (originally held in Aveluy Wood) as the ‘reserve’ wave of the 36th(Ulster) Division attack in front of the German Schwaben Redoubt (initial objective of 109th Brigade).  Intended to exploit their success and push on towards Grandcourt, they walked up into the advance and attacked under intense defilading machine-gun fire through the preceding waves of 108th and 109th Brigades.//
